abstract.text: The base protocol for all TUIkit views.

inlineContent.text: is the central protocol in TUIkit and works similarly to
It defines how components declare their structure and content.
This enables a hierarchical, declarative UI description.
Like SwiftUI, all view operations are confined to the main actor.
This ensures thread-safe access to state, environment, and rendering.

abstract.text: Sets flexible frame constraints for this view.
Sets flexible width constraints for a navigation split view column.
Makes this view the notification rendering host.
An animated loading indicator.
A modifier that displays a decorative badge on a view.
A view that contains multiple child views packed via a parameter pack.
The type of the body view.
A labeled container — always has a title, optionally a footer.
Sets the foreground style for this view and its children.

A view that arranges its children vertically.

The content and behavior of this view.

A view that applies flexible frame constraints to its content.
A declarative, SwiftUI-like framework for building Terminal User Interfaces in Swift.
Adds padding with explicit edge insets.
A view that arranges its children in a line that grows horizontally,
creating items only as needed.
A container view that groups content with optional header and footer.
conforms to View for views that have no body.
Adds a handler for specific key press events.
A flexible spacer that fills available space.

Presents a modal overlay when a binding to a Boolean value is true.
Optional views conform to View when their Wrapped type does.

A scrollable list with keyboard navigation and single selection.
Presents this view as a modal dialog over dimmed content.

A view that arranges its children in a line that grows vertically,

Sets the navigation title for this view.
